summary: Convert all data of a data cube to the given data type.
description:
The convert_data_type process converts all data to the requested data type.  Basic types (and their no-data value) are: bool, int8 (-128), int16 (-32768), int32 (-2147483648), float32 (Float.NaN), float64 (Double.NaN).
For unsigned data types, use the "u" prefix, e.g. uint8, uint16
For raw data types (when you do not want a "no-data" value), use the "raw" suffix, e.g. int8raw, uint8raw, float32raw, ...
If you need to specify a custom "no-data" value, suffix with "ud" and append the integer representation of the no-data value, e.g. int8ud-1 (no-data value of -1), int16ud1234 (no-data value of 1234).

If the data type is not supported, an error is reported (Data type _ is not supported).

parameters.name: data_type
parameters.description: A string representation of the data type to convert to.

returns.description: A data cube with the converted values and the same dimensions. The dimension properties (name, type, labels, reference system and resolution) remain unchanged.
